name: "Supergirl" Season 1 Episode 6 Multiple Choice Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What disaster did Supergirl avert at the beginning of the episode?
questions.correct: Two drivers nearly hit a group of school children.
options: Three men with guns tried to rob a bank.
A Kryptonian attack on a museum.
An alien attack of the police station.
questions.explanation:
Two drivers nearly hit a group of school children.

	Supergirl was flying around "relaxing" when she saw two drivers having a near road rage incident. The two were fighting and nearly ran over a group of school children. She swooped in and saved the day, but in the process she scared the children as she too went into a rage.

questions.text: Lucy's dad appeared in this episode for the first time. He was in town on business. What career did he have?
questions.explanation:
U.S. Army General

	Gen. Sam Lane worked with the U.S. Army. He held very strong anti-alien beliefs and tried to take over the DEO in order to switch up its mission to eradicate all aliens. Lane was against having any aliens on the planet, including Supergirl.

questions.text: Who/what was the main villain Supergirl fought in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Red Tornado.

	Reverb and Reverse Flash were from another TV series, Livewire had been the villain a few episodes earlier. Red Tornado was a military experiment gone wrong. It was a self healing robot programmed to fight aliens, including Supergirl. During a test fight against her, the robot was injured and became evil. The robot was built by Dr. T.O. Morrow.

questions.text: Who hacked into the DEO computers?
questions.explanation:
Winn.

	Winn was the CatCo computer genius and also worked with Supergirl to help her find crimes to stop. He hacked into the DEO to look for information about Jeremiah Danvers, who had died while working for them years earlier.

questions.text: Why did Cat Grant's mother cancel dinner plans with her?
questions.correct: She was invited to a party with Tony Morrison.
options: She got sick and couldn't eat.
She was called away on business.
They got in a fight and she didn't want to be around Cat.
questions.explanation:
She was invited to a party with Tony Morrison.

	Cat and her mother didn't get along well. Cat, one of the most successful business women on the planet, still felt inferior to her mother. Kara had scheduled them a dinner together which the mother cancelled when Toni Morrison invited her to a party.

questions.text: What game did the group play during game night at Kara's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Charades.

	Winn, Kara, James and Lucy were the four at game night. James and Lucy showed off how well they knew each other and their romantic side, which Winn and Kara struggled to stay on the same page.

questions.text: Kara spent some time training at a makeshift gym, what did she use instead of punching bags?
questions.explanation:
Automobiles.

	Instead of punching bags Kara has several cars hung up on joists that she uses to hit. The area is set up inside of an abandoned warehouse. While not explicitly stated, James appears to be the only other person who knows where she goes to relieve stress.

questions.text: Supergirl and the villain of the week fought three times. How many of the fights did the villain win?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Supergirl won the first fight, damaging the robot in the process. It initiated its cloaking mode and flew away. The second fight went in favor of Red Tornado as they fought in the city streets. The third fight went in Supergirl's favor again, as she used every trick she could think of to take down the self-healing robot. He gained sentience and survived the episode.

questions.text: James and Lucy's father got along well and were friends.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Gen. Lane hated James and didn't even try to hide it. He felt that Lucy was too good to be dating a lowly photographer, even if he had won a Pulitzer Prize, and deserved someone better.

questions.text: At the end of the episode Kara appears to have lost her powers.
questions.explanation:
True.

	She cut herself on a piece of broken glass. While that's not typically something someone would worry about, her invulnerability should have stopped such a simple cut. She looked worried and the episode cut to black. Viewers were left wondering what would happen until the next episode.
